pros: Good management Good benefits Positive work environment
cons: Below average wages None others

review_title: If you're not with the "in", you're out
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (AAMA) in Steubenville, OH
pros: The patients you get to meet.
cons: The managers are often rude and in "clicks." If you don't fit in with them, they will find a way to force you out even if they have to lie about you to management and management doesn't care.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Culture is great. Yearly pay increases.
cons: Poor management in some areas. Staffing depending on what’s going on.

pros: Management is nice. Admin is okay.
cons: The location and patient population

pros: Small community hospital with very low census. Easy case load. Typically with a lot of downtime during the 12 hour shift.
cons: 2 RNs in the ED at all times. House supervisors are not very helpful or knowledgeable. Very unorganized and communication is lacking. Not managed very well. This facility is not running with up to date technology. No room for career growth. Poor pay, you can make more working ANY where else, including a nursing home.

pros: premium pay if PRN employee
cons: Staffing crisis, poor leadership, and Trinity is treating full-time employees poorly. The turnover rate is extremely high. Not worth the extra pay.

review_title: Employment at this institution is bleak.
job_title: Registered Nurse/Case Manager in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Most coworkers are nice and helpful.
cons: Low moral and lack of business organisation

review_title: Better than McDonald’s pay, but exhausting
pros: Better pay than McDonalds, but that’s the best I can say. Still not enough to afford rent in the area.
cons: Exhausting, physically intense work with no guaranteed breaks. You may be expected to do more work than assigned without a corresponding increase in pay.. Health insurance will run you $200 per month, whether that’s a good or bad thing I don’t know. There is a yearly .2% raise across the board, which is just enough to keep up with inflation and no more, which means your life won’t improve by working here for years but it will stagnate.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Steubenville, OH
pros: You meet wonderful patients and some of the doctors are amazing!
cons: The supervisors and coworkers are petty and will lie on you and do everything they can to cause you to lose your job.

review_title: Overworked, under payed, some (not all) bad clinical managers / nursing supervisors
pros:
Easy as heck to get a job, they're so desperate.
It's a job, you get income.
Can meet really cool down to earth people, sometimes.
cons:
Understaffed
Overworked
Little pay
No compensation
Staff leaving left and right for other opportunities as myself

pros: good pay and work life balance
cons: I didn't have any cons

pros: 3 nights, the patients are crazy but sweet
cons: Pay, hard work, can have only one tech at night, tiring

pros: It will help advance my career
cons: There are no cons with this job

review_title: Lives up to its mission and vision!
pros: Growing, leadership is honest, transparent and mission driven. Strong teams who support one another.
cons: Some tenured individuals do not like change and tend to hinder growth.

newly consolidated

pros: Good benefits and overtime available for those who want it
cons: Management tends to lack knowledge of the jobs in their own departments and employees.

pros: Family oriented, great co workers, caring

pros: Great  team work with coworkers, friendly attitude of coworkers, good salary. And benefits contributing  403b from  employer
cons: Patients are not refused when it is evident that we are not capable of giving them special care needed and nurses are not safe when psychiatric patients are known to be dangerous but admitted to the unit  regardless

review_title: Trinity Health is a caring company, but low salary and work-life balance
pros: Senior Managers are innovative, try to treat people well with the resources they have.
cons: Low pay for the market and with recent recession, they opted to protect existing jobs (good thing), but freeze the already ridiculously low pay.

pros: Some of the best nurses I've known.  Tremendous teamwork.  Excellent patient care, as far as it is possible.
cons: Administration does not value nursing staff.  You only hear the negative.  No raise in years.  Terrible parking situation.  Terrible cafeteria.

pros: The staff is great and easy to work with. Everyone works as a team. Most doctors are easy to talk to. No apparent new nurse bullying goes on.
cons: The schedule is unpredictable, never consistent and usually posted on short noticed. Forced overtime. Floors are almost always short staffed. All floors could use a full time admission/discharge nurse.

review_title: I held a position where I had a lot of room for advancement within my department
pros: Most of the staff is wonderful
cons: Hard to move to another department & you dont get reg, raises or union

review_title: Worst hospital I have ever worked at
pros: None. Seriously there are none except for the fact that this is the only hospital around.
cons: Low pay, expected to work overtime, management treats you like crap, no raises, little training, severely understaffed so you must do the jobs of 3 people, low moral, burnt out employees, old equipment.

pros:
decent pay and benefits
accrued time
cons:
Patient care is not a priority for administration, the priority is saving money and keeping their high paying administrative jobs instead.
Employees are afraid to speak lately, and SHOULD be.
Very Low morale of staff basically throughout the system.
Watch so you don't get run over by staff trying to run out the door.
